alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and northern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey... Monmouth. In northern New Jersey...Middlesex. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Raritan, Sandy Hook-Staten Island, and Mullica-Toms. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Old Bridge, Marlboro, Tinton Falls, Keansburg, Matawan, Highlands, East Freehold, Adelphia, and Freewood Acres. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 30 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 95 and 102...and between mile markers 117 and 120. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
